title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to pursue free agents this offseason.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are key targets for the Patriots.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips offer potential upgrades at positions of need.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB's new streaming home, offering MLB.TV as a separate add-on for $134.99 with ESPN Unlimited subscription.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can purchase MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited which renews at $29.99 monthly.
Existing MLB.TV users will be automatically renewed, with the option to stream via the MLB app or linked through ESPN's app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, indicating progress in his Achilles injury recovery.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, suggesting he looked like his usual self.
Despite the practice, Tatum's return date remains uncertain, and the Celtics have not provided a specific timetable.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study, leading in higher education attainment.
The state boasts the highest percentage of adults with bachelor's degrees at over 47% and graduate degrees at nearly 22%.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in the rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were at the bottom.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, locally connected to a Taunton family.
Dennis and Douglas Shields, grandsons of the original owner, are selling the card, previously kept within the family.
Current bidding for the card stands at $3.9 million, potentially reaching over $4.7 million with auction fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman to start in net for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, age 27, did not start in last year's 4 Nations Face-Off, but was pivotal in the 2025 IIHF win.
Charlie McAvoy and Swayman will represent the Bruins as Team USA faces Denmark in Olympic preliminaries.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead on a Virginia barrier island, identified by New England Aquarium.
The dead whale marks the second right whale fatality in two weeks, with only about 380 individuals remaining worldwide.
The New England Aquarium and NOAA are investigating the death as part of a broader study on right whale mortality.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children have died from flu-related causes in Massachusetts this season, according to state health department data.
The Massachusetts Department of Public Health reports 260 total flu-related deaths, with 253 being adults.
Public health officials urge flu vaccinations as hospitals deal with capacity strain due to high flu activity.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police offered a 'Valentine’s Day Special' to turn in exes with outstanding warrants.
The initiative was promoted via a humorous Facebook post and heart-themed flyer, attracting community interest.
Similar warrant-themed promotions have been used by police in New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora plans to practice Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer at third and second base during spring training.
Durbin recently joined the Red Sox from the Brewers and was a Rookie of the Year finalist, mainly playing third base.
Boston is considering multiple infield options with Romy Gonzalez, Nick Sogard, and Isiah Kiner-Falefa also in the mix for 2B and 3B.
